name: Idiopathic Mast Cell Activation Syndrome (iMCAS)
chief_complaint: I keep getting random episodes of flushing, dizziness, and throat tightness - like an allergic reaction but without any trigger I can identify
prognosis: Chronic condition requiring long-term management. Approximately 30% of patients achieve good symptom control with combination therapy, while others experience progressive symptoms.
description: A rare variant of mast cell activation disorder where patients experience recurrent, severe mast cell mediator release symptoms without meeting criteria for systemic mastocytosis or having identifiable triggers. Pathophysiology involves abnormal mast cell reactivity to endogenous stimuli rather than IgE-mediated mechanisms.
